qas.question: What is the main ingredient in beer?
What type of water is good for making stout beer, like Guinness?
What type of water is best for making pale lager?
What is the process called when gypsum is added to water?
What type of beer benefits most from water that contains gypsum?
What is composed of mostly beer?
What kind of beer is Dublin's soft water well-suited to make?
What kind of beer is the Plzen Region's hard water well-suited to make?
What kind of beer is the Urquell waters in England ideal for?

context: Beer is composed mostly of <a0_0><b5_0>water<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Regions have water with different mineral components; as a result, different regions were originally better suited to making certain types of beer, thus giving them a regional character. For example, Dublin has <a1_0>hard water<a1_0/> well-suited to making <b6_0>stout<b6_0/>, such as Guinness; while the Plzeň Region has <a2_0>soft water<a2_0/> well-suited to making <b7_0>Pilsner<b7_0/> (pale lager), such as Pilsner Urquell. The waters of Burton in England contain gypsum, which benefits making <a4_0>pale ale<a4_0/> to such a degree that brewers of <b8_0>pale ales<b8_0/> will add gypsum to the local water in a process known as <a3_0>Burtonisation<a3_0/>.
